title: How to Lend a Kindle Book

steps.title: Open Amazon.
steps.content: Open Amazon. Go to https://www.amazon.com/ in your computer's web browser. This will open the Amazon home page. If you aren't logged into your Amazon account, click Sign in in the upper-right side of the page, then enter your email address and password.

steps.title: Select Account & Lists.
steps.content: Select Account & Lists . It's in the upper-right side of the page. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Your Content and Devices.
steps.content: Click Your Content and Devices . This option is in the drop-down menu. Doing so opens a page with your purchased eBooks listed.

steps.title: Find the title you want to lend.
steps.content: Find the title you want to lend. Scroll down until you find the book that you want to lend to a friend.

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . It's to the left of the book's name. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Loan this title.
steps.content: Click Loan this title . If the book is able to be loaned, this is in the drop-down menu. Doing so opens a pop-up menu. If you don't see Loan this title here, the book cannot be loaned.

steps.title: Enter an email address.
steps.content: Enter an email address. Type in the email address of the person to whom you want to send the book. You can also enter a message to your recipient here.

steps.title: Click Send now.
steps.content: Click Send now . It's at the bottom of the pop-up menu. Doing so sends your book to them; they'll have 14 days to read it, after which point the book will be returned to your library.

steps.title: Have your friend return the book when they're done.
steps.content: Have your friend return the book when they're done. To return manually the book you lent before the 14-day reading period is up, your friend can do the following: Open the Your Content and Devices section of their Amazon account on a computer. Click ⋯ to the left of the lent book. Click Delete from library in the drop-down menu. Click Yes when prompted.

steps.title: Open Amazon.
steps.content: Open Amazon. Go to https://www.amazon.com/ in your computer's web browser. This will open the Amazon home page. If you aren't logged into your Amazon account, click Sign in in the upper-right side of the page, then enter your email address and password.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . It's in the top-left corner of the page. A pop-out menu will appear on the left side of the page.

steps.title: Click Kindle E-readers & Books.
steps.content: Click Kindle E-readers & Books . It's in the pop-out menu. An additional menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Kindle Books.
steps.content: Click Kindle Books . This is in the middle of the menu. Doing so opens the Kindle Bookstore.

steps.title: Search for the book you want to lend.
steps.content: Search for the book you want to lend. Type the title of the book into the search bar at the top of the page and press ↵ Enter , or scroll through the popular book titles.

steps.title: Select the book.
steps.content: Select the book. Click the book's name to open the book's page.

steps.title: Click Loan this book.
steps.content: Click Loan this book . It's near the middle of the book's page. If you don't see this option, your book can't be loaned.

steps.title: Enter an email address.
steps.content: Enter an email address. Type in the email address of the person to whom you want to send the book. You can also enter a message to your recipient here.

steps.title: Click Send now.
steps.content: Click Send now . It's at the bottom of the pop-up menu. Doing so sends your book to them; they'll have 14 days to read it, after which point the book will be returned to your library.

To return manually the book you lent before the 14-day reading period is up, your friend can do the following: Open the Your Content and Devices section of their Amazon account on a computer. Click ⋯ to the left of the lent book. Click Delete from library in the drop-down menu. Click Yes when prompted.
